metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9233 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
XML External Entity vulnerability in libexpat 2.2.0 and earlier (Expat XMLParser Library) allows attackers to put the parser in an infinite loopusing a malformed external entity definition from an external DTD.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libcoin80 - 3.1.4~abc9f50-4ubuntu2+esm1
libcoin80-runtime - 3.1.4~abc9f50-4ubuntu2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4').
